title: Base_R_Code
text:
Creating the vectors for the pre and post treatment values


pre_treat <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)

post_treat <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)


Assigning names to the vectror elements


pre_subjects <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(pre_treat) <- pre_subjects
pre_treat

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
       120        151        125        126        115        132        132 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
       129        134        139        127        122        127        135 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
       133        128        147        138        140        132 

post_subjects <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(post_treat) <- post_subjects
post_treat

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
       127        145        135        122        115        122        123 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
       126        126        129        132        146        120        114 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
       121        120        128        120        133        115 



Calculating the change in blood pressure


bp_change <- pre_treat - post_treat
bp_change

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        -7          6        -10          4          0         10          9 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
         3          8         10         -5        -24          7         21 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        12          8         19         18          7         17 



Finding the average blood pressure change


mean(bp_change)

[1] 5.65



Finding patients that experienced a decrease in blood pressure


dec_bp <- which(bp_change > 0)
dec_bp_sub <- names(bp_change)[dec_bp]
dec_bp_sub

 [1] "Subject_2"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8" 
 [6] "Subject_9"  "Subject_10" "Subject_13" "Subject_14" "Subject_15"
[11] "Subject_16" "Subject_17" "Subject_18" "Subject_19" "Subject_20"



Subset returning subjects with a positive change


bool_dec_bp <- bp_change > 0 
bool_dec_bp

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
     FALSE       TRUE      FALSE       TRUE      FALSE       TRUE       TRUE 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
      TRUE       TRUE       TRUE      FALSE      FALSE       TRUE       TRUE 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
      TRUE       TRUE       TRUE       TRUE       TRUE       TRUE 



Calculating average decrease in blood pressure


avg_dec_bp <- mean(dec_bp)
avg_dec_bp

[1] 11.86667

title: Base_R_Code
text:
Creating the vectors for the pre and post treatment values


pre_treat <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)

post_treat <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)


Assigning names to the vectror elements


pre_subjects <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(pre_treat) <- pre_subjects
pre_treat

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
       120        151        125        126        115        132        132 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
       129        134        139        127        122        127        135 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
       133        128        147        138        140        132 

post_subjects <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(post_treat) <- post_subjects
post_treat

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
       127        145        135        122        115        122        123 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
       126        126        129        132        146        120        114 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
       121        120        128        120        133        115 



Calculating the change in blood pressure


bp_change <- pre_treat - post_treat
bp_change

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        -7          6        -10          4          0         10          9 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
         3          8         10         -5        -24          7         21 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        12          8         19         18          7         17 



Finding the average blood pressure change


mean(bp_change)

[1] 5.65



Finding patients that experienced a decrease in blood pressure


dec_bp <- which(bp_change > 0)
dec_bp_sub <- names(bp_change)[dec_bp]
dec_bp_sub

 [1] "Subject_2"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8" 
 [6] "Subject_9"  "Subject_10" "Subject_13" "Subject_14" "Subject_15"
[11] "Subject_16" "Subject_17" "Subject_18" "Subject_19" "Subject_20"



Subset returning subjects with a positive change


bool_dec_bp <- bp_change > 0 
bool_dec_bp

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
     FALSE       TRUE      FALSE       TRUE      FALSE       TRUE       TRUE 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
      TRUE       TRUE       TRUE      FALSE      FALSE       TRUE       TRUE 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
      TRUE       TRUE       TRUE       TRUE       TRUE       TRUE 



Calculating average decrease in blood pressure


avg_dec_bp <- mean(dec_bp)
avg_dec_bp

[1] 11.86667

title: Base_R_Code
text:
Task 2: Basic Data Frame Practice

Creating a data frame


patients <- paste("subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
bp_df <- data.frame(patients, pre_treat, post_treat, bp_change)
bp_df

             patients pre_treat post_treat bp_change
Subject_1   subject_1       120        127        -7
Subject_2   subject_2       151        145         6
Subject_3   subject_3       125        135       -10
Subject_4   subject_4       126        122         4
Subject_5   subject_5       115        115         0
Subject_6   subject_6       132        122        10
Subject_7   subject_7       132        123         9
Subject_8   subject_8       129        126         3
Subject_9   subject_9       134        126         8
Subject_10 subject_10       139        129        10
Subject_11 subject_11       127        132        -5
Subject_12 subject_12       122        146       -24
Subject_13 subject_13       127        120         7
Subject_14 subject_14       135        114        21
Subject_15 subject_15       133        121        12
Subject_16 subject_16       128        120         8
Subject_17 subject_17       147        128        19
Subject_18 subject_18       138        120        18
Subject_19 subject_19       140        133         7
Subject_20 subject_20       132        115        17

dim(bp_df)

[1] 20  4



Rows where difference is negative


subset <- bp_df[bp_df$bp_change < 0, ]
subset

             patients pre_treat post_treat bp_change
Subject_1   subject_1       120        127        -7
Subject_3   subject_3       125        135       -10
Subject_11 subject_11       127        132        -5
Subject_12 subject_12       122        146       -24



Adding a new column


bp_df$bp120 <- c(post_treat < "120")


Printing out data frame


knitr::kable(bp_df)

title: Base_R_Code
text:
Task 3: List Practice
Entering the placebo treatment numbers

plac_pre_treat <- c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130)
plac_post_treat <-c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)


Creating new placebo patient data frame


plac_patients <- paste("subject", 1:10, sep = "_")
plac_bp_change <- plac_pre_treat - plac_post_treat
plac_bp120 <- plac_post_treat < "120"
plac_bp_df <- data.frame(plac_patients, plac_pre_treat, plac_post_treat, plac_bp_change, plac_bp120)
plac_bp_df

   plac_patients plac_pre_treat plac_post_treat plac_bp_change plac_bp120
1      subject_1            138             105             33       TRUE
2      subject_2            135             136             -1      FALSE
3      subject_3            147             123             24      FALSE
4      subject_4            117             130            -13      FALSE
5      subject_5            152             134             18      FALSE
6      subject_6            134             143             -9      FALSE
7      subject_7            114             135            -21      FALSE
8      subject_8            121             139            -18      FALSE
9      subject_9            131             120             11      FALSE
10    subject_10            130             124              6      FALSE



Creating the list with two elements


bp_list <- list(treatment = bp_df, placebo = plac_bp_df)
bp_list

$treatment
             patients pre_treat post_treat bp_change bp120
Subject_1   subject_1       120        127        -7 FALSE
Subject_2   subject_2       151        145         6 FALSE
Subject_3   subject_3       125        135       -10 FALSE
Subject_4   subject_4       126        122         4 FALSE
Subject_5   subject_5       115        115         0  TRUE
Subject_6   subject_6       132        122        10 FALSE
Subject_7   subject_7       132        123         9 FALSE
Subject_8   subject_8       129        126         3 FALSE
Subject_9   subject_9       134        126         8 FALSE
Subject_10 subject_10       139        129        10 FALSE
Subject_11 subject_11       127        132        -5 FALSE
Subject_12 subject_12       122        146       -24 FALSE
Subject_13 subject_13       127        120         7 FALSE
Subject_14 subject_14       135        114        21  TRUE
Subject_15 subject_15       133        121        12 FALSE
Subject_16 subject_16       128        120         8 FALSE
Subject_17 subject_17       147        128        19 FALSE
Subject_18 subject_18       138        120        18 FALSE
Subject_19 subject_19       140        133         7 FALSE
Subject_20 subject_20       132        115        17  TRUE

$placebo
   plac_patients plac_pre_treat plac_post_treat plac_bp_change plac_bp120
1      subject_1            138             105             33       TRUE
2      subject_2            135             136             -1      FALSE
3      subject_3            147             123             24      FALSE
4      subject_4            117             130            -13      FALSE

6      subject_6            134             143             -9      FALSE
7      subject_7            114             135            -21      FALSE
8      subject_8            121             139            -18      FALSE
9      subject_9            131             120             11      FALSE
10    subject_10            130             124              6      FALSE
